questions.question: The girl said that she ............................... unwell.
questions.description: After a past reporting verb, we normally use a past tense in the reported speech.

questions.question: He said that his master ............................... his dinner.
questions.description: After a past reporting verb, we normally use a past tense in the reported speech.

questions.question: The boy said that the horse .............................. in the night.
questions.description: Simple past in the direct speech becomes past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: She told me that she ............................. trust me.
He ........................ that he is glad to be here this evening.
questions.description: We use a present tense in the reported speech only when the reporting verb is in the present tense.

questions.question: The stranger asked where ............................
questions.description: Do is not used in reported questions.

questions.question: My mother asked me whether I ..................................... a man like him.
questions.description: Will in the direct speech becomes would in the indirect speech.

questions.question: The visitor requested the girl ............................ a glass of water.
questions.description: We use to-infinitives to report commands, orders, requests etc.

questions.question: The mother wrote that she ............................... and longing for her son's return.
questions.description: Present tenses in the direct speech become corresponding past tenses in the indirect speech.

questions.question: I told him that I ............................... his friend for months.
He asked me ................................
questions.description: In reported questions we do not use do. does or did.

questions.question: The speaker said that it ......................... him great pleasure to be there that evening.
questions.description: Present tenses in the direct speech become corresponding past tenses in the indirect speech.
